Instrument.name: Jovian Infrared Auroral Mapper
Instrument.description: The Jovian Infrared Auroral Mapper (JIRAM) was designed to provide a visual and thermal infrared view of Jupiterâ€™s aurora. JIRAM combines two data channels in one instrument: an imager and a spectrometer that are housed in the same optical subsystem. Objectives include: (1) imaging the polar regions of Jupiter in the spectral range of 3.2-3.8 micrometer where most of the auroral emissions occur; and (2) performing co-located spectroscopy and imaging of selected regions of the atmosphere in the broader 2.0-5.0 micrometer range with medium spectral resolution.
